div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Sept. 27, 1895. MORE CONTRIBUTIONS FOR ST. HEDWIG PARISH FAIR

body.p: The following donations have recently been received by the St. Hedwig Parish Fair Committee:
Paul Ogurek: two dozen bottles of wine and two cases of soda water.
Michael Wachowski: three barrels of beer.
Rose 11 of the Women's Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: $7.50
Rose 23 of the Women's Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: $4.35
John Nowicki: a pair of pigeons.
Albert Metys: a statue of the Blessed Virgin.
Joseph Pilarski: a pair of pigeons
Stanislaus Mindak: harness for a horse, valued at twenty-five dollars.
Joseph Mulzof: one table cloth, one stuffed pillow for a davenport, and a
one table set, one table cloth and one bedspread.
one box of soap, one box of washing powder and a pair of
One dozen bottles of wine and two cases of soda water.
Sincere thanks are extended to all kind donors by the parish committee.
